title: Add no-op Map (2D) button next to Flying in Travelogue journey cards

requirements.summary: Render a new "Map" button with a visible "2D" mark immediately to the right of the existing "Flying" button in each Travelogue journey card action area.
acceptanceCriteria: In the Travelogue panel, each journey card that shows the Flying button also shows a new Map button immediately to its right.
The Map buttonâ€™s visible label text is exactly "Map".
The Map button includes a visible "2D" logo/icon mark.

file_operations.description: Locate the journey card action controls where the existing "Flying" button is rendered (within the JourneyCard UI), and add a new adjacent button immediately to its right labeled exactly "Map" with a compact visible "2D" mark/icon alongside the label (text-based is acceptable). Ensure the new button is rendered everywhere the Flying button appears (for live/upcoming/past journey cards). Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui.

requirements.summary: Make the new "Map" button a pure no-op placeholder that only shows standard press visuals and does not change state, navigate, or trigger side effects.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the Map button produces no navigation or panel/dialog changes.
No toast/notification is shown as a result of clicking the Map button.
No backend calls are initiated by clicking the Map button.

file_operations.description: Implement the "Map" button click handler as a no-op placeholder (e.g., prevent default/stop propagation if needed) and ensure it does not call any hooks/mutations, does not set React state, does not open dialogs, does not trigger toasts, and does not initiate network/backend calls. Keep existing Flying behavior unchanged.
